title: What Does the Lime 🍋‍🟩 Emoji Mean? Its Uses & Design, Explained

steps.title: Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to talk about a literal lime.
steps.content: Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to talk about a literal lime. In most cases, the meaning of this bright green emoji is pretty straightforward—it symbolizes the tart and zesty fruit used in foods and drinks. Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to replace the word “lime” or talk about any lime-flavored food or drinks. [1] X Research source “The tropical punch could use some more 🍋‍🟩” “I love adding a squeeze of 🍋‍🟩 on top of my soup.” “The recipe calls for one teaspoon of lime zest 🍋‍🟩” “I love to freeze lime juice in ice trays and add them to my sparkling water 🍋‍🟩”

steps.title: Show your love of Mexican cuisine (or food and drink in general) with a 🍋‍🟩 emoji.
steps.content: Show your love of Mexican cuisine (or food and drink in general) with a 🍋‍🟩 emoji. Lime is a key ingredient in Mexican dishes because it adds brightness and acidity, without overpowering other flavors. Pair 🍋‍🟩 with the taco, burrito, or avocado emoji, depending on what you’re craving. “It’s Taco Tuesday! 🌮🍹🍋‍🟩” “Want to grab burritos later? 🌯🍋‍🟩” “UGH, I really want a margarita rn 🍋‍🟩” “I’m bringing chips and guac to the party 🥑🍋‍🟩😙”

steps.title: Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to represent summertime.
steps.content: Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to represent summertime. Limes may be available year-round, but they’re definitely the best in the summer. Use the 🍋‍🟩 emoji to gush about your favorite tropical treats or excitement for warmer weather. [2] X Research source “I can’t believe it’s summertime 🥥🌴🌺🍍🍋‍🟩” “I’m ready to relax on the beach with a daiquiri in my hand 🍋‍🟩🍹😎🏝” “My mom is making her signature key lime pie for the Fourth of July party 🍋‍🟩” “I’m so excited for our vacay! Let’s drink margaritas for 5 hours straight 🤭🏖️🍋‍🟩🍹”

steps.title: Talk about all things lime green with a 🍋‍🟩 emoji.
steps.content: Talk about all things lime green with a 🍋‍🟩 emoji. Resting between yellow green and yellow in the color wheel, lime green is a bright green shade that resembles the skin of the citrus fruit. It represents nature, confidence, and energy, and is believed to promote feelings of liveliness, freshness, and creativity. [3] X Research source Drop the 🍋‍🟩 emoji the next time you have a painting project or are searching for something lime green. “I’m looking for a 🍋‍🟩 colored dress.” “Should I make the slides 🍋‍🟩 green?” “Can you highlight the text in lime green? 🍋‍🟩” “I’m thinking of adding lime accents to the drawers 🍋‍🟩 What do you think?”

steps.title: Samsung, Google, and Apple support the 🍋‍🟩 lime emoji.
steps.content: Samsung, Google, and Apple support the 🍋‍🟩 lime emoji. It’s available on the latest Samsung devices (via One UI 6.0), Google’s Noto Emoji fonts (via Emoji 15.1), and iOS 17.4. [4] X Research source If you are unable to update your device’s software, you may not be able to view the lime emoji as a single emoji design. [5] X Research source The 🍋‍🟩 emoji was approved in September 2023 as part of Emoji 15.1.

steps.title: Combine the lemon 🍋 and green square 🟩 emojis with a zero width joiner.
steps.content: Combine the lemon 🍋 and green square 🟩 emojis with a zero width joiner. Currently, the 🍋‍🟩 emoji has limited support across platforms, so you may not have easy access to it. On devices that don't support the emoji, it appears as a ZWJ sequence combining the 🍋 lemon emoji, zero width joiner, and 🟩 green square emoji. [6] X Research source The ZWJ ("zwidge") is an invisible Unicode character that takes up no space. When placed between 2 emojis, it will combine them to form a new design. Create the ZWJ in HTML with codes &zwj or ‍ or U+200D in Unicode.

steps.title: Or, copy and paste the 🍋‍🟩 emoji across platforms.
steps.content: Or, copy and paste the 🍋‍🟩 emoji across platforms. Highlight the 🍋‍🟩 emoji, right-click the mouse or trackpad, and hit “Copy.” Then, navigate to the space you want to paste the emoji, right-click the mouse or trackpad, and hit “Paste” to copy and paste the 🍋‍🟩 emoji on your computer.

steps.title: The 🍋‍🟩 emoji depicts a lime slice with dark green skin and light green flesh.
steps.content: The 🍋‍🟩 emoji depicts a lime slice with dark green skin and light green flesh. When the lime emoji design was first revealed in January 2023, it appeared as a whole lime, similar to the 🍊 tangerine and 🍋 lemon emojis. [7] X Research source It was ultimately changed into a sliced lime, probably because people tend to slice and squeeze limes for drinks or add them as a garnish instead of consuming the fruit whole. In the past, many users were annoyed and confused as to why the 🍋‍🟩 was excluded from the fruit emoji kingdom. There was a lot of public support for the emoji, including a change.org petition , so Apple finally decided to release it!

steps.title: The 🍋‍🟩 emoji is just one of many fruit emojis.
steps.content: The 🍋‍🟩 emoji is just one of many fruit emojis. From the cherry emoji to the watermelon emoji , there are tons of ways to share your love of fruit. Use any of the following emojis to spice up your texts or come up with your own secret message: 🍇 (grapes) 🍈 (melon) 🍉 (watermelon) 🍊 (tangerine) 🍋 (lemon) 🍌 (banana) 🍍 (pineapple) 🥭 (mango) 🍎 (red apple) 🍏 (green apple) 🍐 (pear) 🍑 (peach) 🍒 (cherries) 🍓 (strawberry) 🫐 (blueberries) 🥝 (kiwi fruit) 🥥 (coconut)
